item.title: AWS - US West (Oregon): INC0102987
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Incident with Snowflake Services

Customers experienced issues accessing Snowflake services due to a degraded state in the metadata database. The incident has been resolved, but some customers may still experience ingestion delays. A root cause analysis will be published within seven business days.

Feb 20, 14:47 PST
Resolved - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue and monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Customers may have been unable to access Snowflake services. Please note that a subset of customers may continue to experience Snowpipe ingestion delays while existing queues are processed.
Incident start time: 21:34 UTC February 20, 2024
Incident end time: 21:56 UTC February 20, 2024
Preliminary root cause: Our preliminary investigation indicates the metadata database temporarily entered a degraded state, preventing users from accessing multiple Snowflake services.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within seven business days.

Feb 20, 14:16 PST
Monitoring - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue, and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.
Customer experience: Customers may have been unable to access Snowflake services.
Incident start time: 21:34 UTC February 20, 2024
Incident end time: 21:56 UTC February 20, 2024
Preliminary root cause: Our preliminary investigation indicates the metadata database temporarily entered a degraded state, preventing users from accessing multiple Snowflake services.

Feb 20, 13:49 PST
Investigating - Current status: We're investigating an issue with multiple Snowflake services. We'll provide an update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Customers may be unable to access Snowflake services.
Incident start time: 21:38 UTC February 20, 2024

item.title: Azure - Central US (Iowa): INC0102516
item.content:encoded:
Feb 9, 10:23 PST
Resolved - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue and monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have experienced delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features using Snowsight.
Incident start time: 14:10 UTC February 09, 2024
Incident end time: 17:05 UTC February 09, 2024
Preliminary root cause: A subset of infrastructure that supports our Cloud Services layer entered a degraded state and caused a queue of operations to form. This resulted in a service performance degradation for some customers hosted within this region.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within seven business days.

Feb 9, 09:25 PST
Monitoring - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue, and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.

Incident start time: 14:10 UTC February 09, 2024
Incident end time: 17:05 UTC February 09, 2024
Preliminary root cause: A subset of infrastructure that supports our Cloud Services layer entered a degraded state and caused a queue of operations to form. This resulted in a service performance degradation for some customers hosted within this region.

Feb 9, 08:54 PST
Identified - Current status: We've identified the source of the issue, and we're developing and implementing a fix to restore service. We'll provide another update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features using Snowsight.
Incident start time: 14:10 UTC February 09, 2024

Feb 9, 08:17 PST
Investigating - Current status: We're investigating an issue with Snowflake Data Cloud. We'll provide an update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features using Snowsight.
Incident start time: 15:32 UTC February 09, 2024

item.title: 3 Deployments Affected: INC0101302
item.content:encoded:
Jan 21, 03:35 PST
Resolved - Current status: We've coordinated with our third-party service provider to implement the fix for this issue, and we've monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have been unable to execute queries. Additionally, customers may have observed that Snowpipe file ingestion was stopped or delayed.
Incident start time: 02:52 UTC January 21, 2024
Incident end time: 09:50 UTC January 21, 2024
Preliminary root cause: A third-party service provider experienced an issue affecting resource management operations, which caused impact to warehouse provisioning systems.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within ten business days.

Jan 21, 03:02 PST
Monitoring - Current status: We've coordinated with our third-party service provider to implement the fix for this issue, and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.

Incident start time: 02:52 UTC January 21, 2024
Incident end time: 09:50 UTC January 21, 2024
Preliminary root cause: A third-party service provider experienced an issue affecting resource management operations, which caused impact to warehouse provisioning systems.

Jan 21, 00:43 PST
Update - Current status: We've identified an issue with a third-party service provider, and we're coordinating with the provider to develop and implement a fix to restore service. The impact has been mitigated for most regions, except West Europe (Netherlands). We will offer further updates as soon as we receive information from the third-party service provider.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may be unable to execute queries.
Workaround: There are currently no available workarounds for this issue.
Incident start time: 02:52 UTC January 21, 2024

item.title: Azure - East US 2 (Virginia): INC0100718
item.content:encoded:
Jan 18, 15:07 PST
Resolved - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue and monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have experienced intermittent delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features.
Incident start time: 15:55 UTC January 18, 2024
Incident end time: 20:45 UTC January 18, 2024
Preliminary root cause: We identified an increase in error rates indicating a reoccurrence of INC0100501 for a subset of customers. Snowflake is treating this issue with the highest priority while we continue to investigate the underlying cause affecting subsystems related to request-routing infrastructure for our cloud services and query-processing layers. Additionally, we are implementing proactive measures to help prevent additional reoccurrence including adding monitoring enhancements and increasing infrastructure capacity on the affected systems.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within seven business days.

Jan 18, 10:16 PST
Monitoring - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue, and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have experienced delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features.
Incident start time: 15:55 UTC January 18, 2024
Incident end time: 17:00 UTC January 18, 2024
Preliminary root cause: We identified an increase in error rates indicating a reoccurrence of INC0100501 for a subset of customers. Snowflake is treating this issue with the highest priority while we continue to investigate the underlying cause affecting subsystems related to request-routing infrastructure for our cloud services and query-processing layers. Additionally, we are implementing proactive measures to help prevent additional reoccurrence including adding monitoring enhancements and increasing infrastructure capacity on the affected systems.

Jan 18, 09:34 PST
Identified - Current status: We've identified an increase in error rates indicating a reoccurrence of INC0100501 for a subset of customers, and we're taking action to restart affected request-routing infrastructure to restore service. We'll provide another update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features.

Jan 18, 09:02 PST
Investigating - Current status: We're investigating an issue with Snowflake Data Cloud. We'll provide an update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features.

item.title: Azure - East US 2 (Virginia): INC0100501
item.content:encoded:
Jan 17, 11:25 PST
Resolved - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue and monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have experienced delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features. If you are continuing to experience issues accessing the Snowflake user interface, please attempt to clear your browser cache and sign in again.
Incident start time: 14:38 UTC January 17, 2024
Incident end time: 17:32 UTC January 17, 2024
Preliminary root cause: We identified that subsystems related to request-routing infrastructure for our cloud services and query-processing layers entered a degraded state, and we restarted affected systems to mitigate impact.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within seven business days.

Jan 17, 10:25 PST
Monitoring - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue, and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.

Incident end time: 17:32 UTC January 17, 2024
Preliminary root cause: We identified that subsystems related to request-routing infrastructure for our cloud services and query-processing layers entered a degraded state, and we restarted affected systems to mitigate impact.

Jan 17, 09:31 PST
Update - Current status: We have correlated an identified increase in error rates with subsystems related to request-routing infrastructure, and we are restarting affected components as a potential mitigation.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features.

Jan 17, 08:28 PST
Update - Current status: We identified an increase in error rates between our cloud services and query processing layers, and are rolling back all recent environment changes as a precaution as we continue to investigate. We'll provide another update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features.

Jan 17, 07:26 PST
Investigating - Current status: We're investigating an issue with Snowflake Data Cloud. We'll provide an update within 60 minutes.

Dec 7, 22:17 PST

item.title: AWS - US East (N. Virginia): INC0098257
item.content:encoded:
Dec 7, 17:20 PST
Resolved - Current status: We identified an issue that caused a subset of infrastructure (responsible for PrivateLink traffic management) to enter a degraded state, resulting in intermittent connectivity issues for some customers. As the issue is intermittent, subsequent connection retries would have been successful. While we initially implemented temporary mitigation at 21:21 UTC, which provided relief, a long-term fix of scaling up our infrastructure was carried out to ensure system stability.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have experienced intermittent connectivity issues when connecting to Snowflake services and features over PrivateLink.
Incident start time: 10:29 UTC December 07, 2023
Incident end time: 21:21 UTC December 07, 2023
Preliminary root cause: Preliminary investigation suggests an insufficient resource issue, which gradually impacted our system's ability to process PrivateLink traffic, resulting in intermittent issues on logging to Snowflake system.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within seven business days.

Dec 7, 16:15 PST
Monitoring - Current status: We identified an issue that caused a subset of infrastructure (responsible for PrivateLink traffic management) to enter a degraded state, resulting in intermittent connectivity issues for some customers. As the issue is intermittent, subsequent connection retries would have been successful. While we initially implemented temporary mitigation to provide relief, a long-term fix of scaling up our infrastructure was carried out to ensure system stability.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may be experiencing intermittent connectivity issues when connecting to Snowflake services and features over PrivateLink.
Incident start time: 10:29 UTC December 07, 2023
Incident end time: 21:21 UTC December 07, 2023
Preliminary root cause: Preliminary investigation suggests an insufficient resource issue, which gradually impacted our system's ability to process PrivateLink traffic, resulting in intermittent issues on logging to Snowflake system.

Dec 7, 14:28 PST
Update - Current status: We identified an issue causing a subset of infrastructure that facilitates PrivateLink traffic management to enter a degraded state, resulting in intermittent connectivity issues for some customers. We have implemented a temporary mitigation to provide additional relief while we continue to address the underlying source of the issue. As the issue is intermittent in nature, subsequent connection retries may also be successful. We'll provide another update within 2 hours.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may be experiencing intermittent connectivity issues when connecting to Snowflake services and features over PrivateLink.
Incident start time: 10:29 UTC December 07, 2023

Dec 7, 13:25 PST
Identified - Current status: We've identified the source of the issue, and we're developing and implementing a fix to restore service. We'll provide another update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may be experiencing intermittent connectivity issues when connecting to Snowflake services and features over PrivateLink.
Incident start time: 10:29 UTC December 07, 2023

Dec 7, 11:56 PST
Investigating - Current status: We're investigating an issue with Snowflake Data Cloud. We'll provide an update within 90 minutes.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may be experiencing intermittent connectivity issues when connecting to Snowflake services and features over PrivateLink.
Incident start time: 10:29 UTC December 07, 2023

item.title: AWS - US West (Oregon): INC0096454
item.content:encoded:
Nov 7, 22:00 PST
Resolved - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue and monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Affected users would have experienced Snowpipe ingestion latency and delays when streaming data via the Kafka Connector while the backlog of ingestion requests is processed.
Incident start time: 18:00 UTC November 07, 2023
Incident end time: 04:30 UTC November 08, 2023
Preliminary root cause: A system configuration change resulted in Snowpipe ingestion performance degradation.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within seven business days.

Nov 7, 21:15 PST
Monitoring - Current status: We've temporarily rolled back specific Snowflake software configurations to the previous release which addressed the data ingestion performance and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.
Customer experience: Affected users may experience Snowpipe ingestion latency and delays when streaming data via the Kafka Connector while the backlog of ingestion requests is processed.
Incident start time: 18:00 UTC November 07, 2023
Incident end time: 04:30 UTC November 08, 2023
Preliminary root cause: A system configuration change resulted in Snowpipe ingestion performance degradation.

Nov 7, 18:44 PST
Update - Current status: We've temporarily rolled back specific Snowflake software configurations to the previous release to tackle the data ingestion performance problem. We're actively monitoring the service for complete recovery. We'll provide another update within 2 hours.
Customer experience: Affected users may experience Snowpipe ingestion latency and delays when streaming data via the Kafka Connector while the backlog of ingestion requests is processed.
Incident start time: 18:00 UTC November 07, 2023

Nov 7, 17:47 PST
Update - Current status: We're temporarily reverting a subset of Snowflake software configurations to its previous release to address the data ingestion performance issue. We'll provide another update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Affected users may experience Snowpipe ingestion latency and delays when streaming data via the Kafka Connector while the backlog of ingestion requests is processed.
Incident start time: 18:00 UTC November 07, 2023

Nov 7, 16:47 PST
Update - Current status: We've identified the source of the issue, and we're developing and implementing a fix to restore service. We'll provide another update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Affected users may experience Snowpipe ingestion latency and delays when streaming data via the Kafka Connector while the backlog of ingestion requests is processed.
Incident start time: 18:00 UTC November 07, 2023

Nov 7, 14:28 PST
Update - Current status: Our telemetry indicates that the backlog of requests continues to process as expected. We'll provide an update within 2 hours or upon complete service recovery.
Customer experience: Affected users may experience Snowpipe ingestion latency and delays when streaming data via the Kafka Connector while the backlog of ingestion requests is processed.
Incident start time: 18:00 UTC November 07, 2023

Nov 7, 13:27 PST
Update - Current status: Our monitoring indicates that the rollback was successful in mitigating the issue; however, affected customers may still experience delays while the backlog of ingestion requests is processed. We'll provide an update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Affected users may experience Snowpipe ingestion latency and delays when streaming data via the Kafka Connector.
Incident start time: 18:00 UTC November 07, 2023

Nov 7, 12:41 PST
Identified - Current status: We've completed a rollback of a recent configuration change, and our telemetry indicates that service health is recovering. In parallel, we're continuing to monitor and investigate further to isolate and address the source of the issue. We'll provide an update within 60 minutes.
Customer experience: Affected users may experience Snowpipe ingestion latency and delays when streaming data via the Kafka Connector.
Incident start time: 18:00 UTC November 07, 2023

Nov 7, 11:57 PST
Investigating - Current status: We're investigating an issue with Snowpipe ingestion delays. We'll provide an update within 60 minutes.

item.title: AWS - Asia Pacific (Singapore): INC0095146
item.content:encoded:
Oct 25, 06:06 PDT
Resolved - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue and monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Users could experience increased latency when loading the Snowflake UI or when running queries via the UI.
Incident start time: 07:00 UTC October 25, 2023
Incident end time: 11:37 UTC October 25, 2023
Preliminary root cause: Resource exhaustion within the infrastructure stack between Snowsight and Snowflake Database.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within seven business days.

Monitoring - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue, and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.
Customer experience: Users could experience increased latency when loading the Snowflake UI or when running queries via the UI.
Incident start time: 07:00 UTC October 25, 2023
Incident end time: 11:37 UTC October 25, 2023
Preliminary root cause: Resource exhaustion within the infrastructure stack between Snowsight and Snowflake Database.

Oct 25, 04:06 PDT
Update - Current status: We're continuing to investigate to determine the source of the issue. We'll provide another update within 60 minutes.

item.title: AWS - US East (N. Virginia): INC0094921
item.content:encoded:
Oct 20, 12:12 PDT
Resolved - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue and monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have experienced delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features, such as replication between accounts, Snowpipe file ingestion, and managing (e.g. creating, suspending, or resuming) virtual warehouses.
Incident start time: 17:00 UTC October 20, 2023
Incident end time: 17:45 UTC October 20, 2023
Preliminary root cause: A subset of infrastructure that supports the metadata database layer became degraded, causing operations dependent on this layer to become temporarily throttled.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within seven business days.

Oct 20, 11:12 PDT
Monitoring - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue, and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.

Incident end time: 17:45 UTC October 20, 2023
Preliminary root cause: A subset of infrastructure that supports the metadata database layer became degraded, causing operations dependent on this layer to become temporarily throttled.

Oct 20, 10:28 PDT
Investigating - Current status: We're investigating an issue with Snowflake Data Cloud. We'll provide an update within 60 minutes.

item.title: 5 Deployments Affected: INC0092585
item.content:encoded:
Sep 18, 23:31 PDT
Resolved - Current status: We've coordinated with our third-party service provider, who implemented a fix to restore service to the AWS - US West (Oregon) and AWS - US East (N. Virginia) regions. The environments have remained stable, which confirms that services were restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: A subset of customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to execute queries. Affected customers may encounter query failures.
Incident start time: 17:05 UTC September 18, 2023
Incident end time: 04:06 UTC September 19, 2023
Preliminary root cause: A third-party service provider experienced a network issue, which caused performance degradation and errors with query execution.

Sep 18, 22:15 PDT
Monitoring - Current status: We've coordinated with our third-party service provider who implemented a fix to restore service to the AWS - US West (Oregon) region as well as AWS - US East (N. Virginia). We will continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.
Customer experience: A subset of customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to execute queries. Affected customers may encounter query failures.
Incident start time: 17:05 UTC September 18, 2023
Incident end time: 04:06 UTC September 19, 2023
Preliminary root cause: A third-party service provider experienced a network issue, which caused performance degradation and errors with query execution.

Sep 18, 20:57 PDT
Update - Current status: We continue to coordinate with our third-party service provider who has identified the issue and continuing to implement a fix to restore full service on the AWS - US West (Oregon) region. Services on AWS - US East (N. Virginia) have been restored as of 21:52 UTC where a preliminary investigation indicated a networking issue within AWS Virtual Private Cloud service. AWS continues to work on the service restoration of the AWS US West 2 region and a fix has been applied to address the potential cause of the network issue. The fix continues to propagate to the rest of the region which should incrementally alleviate the latencies or performance degradation of impacted services. Our Engineering Teams continue to actively monitor the infrastructure to ensure that the number of servers in the free pool remains in line with demand. We'll provide another update within 120 minutes.
Customer experience: A subset of customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to execute queries. Affected customers may encounter query failures.
Incident start time: 17:05 UTC September 18, 2023

Sep 18, 18:38 PDT
Update - Current status: We continue to coordinate with our third-party service provider who has identified the issue and is now implementing a fix to restore full service on the AWS - US West (Oregon) region. Services on AWS - US East (N. Virginia) have been restored as of 21:52 UTC where preliminary investigation states a networking issue within AWS Virtual Private Cloud service. Our Engineering Teams continue to actively monitor the infrastructure to ensure that the number of servers in the free pool remains in line with demand. We'll provide another update within 120 minutes.
Customer experience: A subset of customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to execute queries. Affected customers may encounter query failures.
Incident start time: 17:05 UTC September 18, 2023

item.title: AWS - Europe (Paris): INC0089352
item.content:encoded:
Aug 3, 07:33 PDT
Resolved - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue and monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Customers were unable to access and use Snowsight services and features when leveraging a regionless URL. As a result, users were unable to log in, queries may have not executed, and users may have observed HTTP 403 errors.
Incident start time: 05:39 UTC August 02, 2023
Incident end time: 14:05 UTC August 03, 2023
Preliminary root cause: An application role granted to Snowsight was misconfigured, preventing users from leveraging regionless URLs to use Snowflake services.
A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within seven business days.

Aug 3, 07:19 PDT
Monitoring - Current status: We've implemented the fix for this issue, and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.
Customer experience: Customers were unable to access and use Snowsight services and features when leveraging a regionless URL. As a result, users were unable to log in, queries may have not executed, and users may have observed HTTP 403 errors.
Incident start time: 05:39 UTC August 02, 2023
Incident end time: 14:05 UTC August 03, 2023
Preliminary root cause: An application role granted to Snowsight was misconfigured, preventing users from leveraging regionless URLs to use Snowflake services.

Aug 3, 00:02 PDT
Update - Current status: We have confirmed the source of the issue and tests of the potential fix have been successful. We continue with our efforts of implementing the fix. We will provide another update in eight hours, or earlier, pending any significant change in status.
Customer experience: Customers may be unable to access and use Snowsight services and features when leveraging a regionless URL. As a result, users may be unable to log in, queries may not execute, and users may observe HTTP 403 errors.
Workaround: As a workaround, users can still access Snowsight via a regional locator URL or by going to https://app.snowflake.com and pasting in their account URL to log in.
Incident start time: 05:39 UTC August 02, 2023

Aug 2, 16:07 PDT
Identified - Current status: We have confirmed the source of the issue and tests of the potential fix have been successful. We are now moving forward with implementing the fix, which is expected to be completed in approximately eight hours. We will provide another update in eight hours.

Workaround: As a workaround, users can still access Snowsight via a regional locator URL or by going to https://app.snowflake.com and pasting in their account URL to log in.
Incident start time: 05:39 UTC August 02, 2023

Incident start time: 05:39 UTC August 02, 2023

item.title: Azure - West Europe (Netherlands): INC0087629
item.content:encoded:
Jul 5, 16:08 PDT
Resolved - Current status: We've coordinated with our third-party service provider to implement the fix for this issue, and we've monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.

Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have experienced delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features.

Incident start time: 07:22 UTC July 05, 2023
Incident end time: 16:00 UTC July 05, 2023

Preliminary root cause: A third-party service provider experienced a fiber cut caused by severe weather conditions causing downstream impact that may have prevented access to Snowflake features and services.

A root cause analysis (RCA) document will be published within ten business days.

Jul 5, 12:24 PDT
Monitoring - Current status: We've coordinated with our third-party service provider to implement the fix for this issue, and our internal telemetry indicates that this issue is largely resolved. We'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.

Additional details related to the third-party service provider's restoration efforts in response to a fiber cut caused by severe weather conditions are available here:
https://azure.status.microsoft/en-gb/status

Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have experienced delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features.

Incident start time: 07:22 UTC July 05, 2023
Incident end time: 16:00 UTC July 05, 2023

Preliminary root cause: A third-party service provider experienced a fiber cut caused by severe weather conditions causing downstream impact that may have prevented access to Snowflake features and services.

Jul 5, 10:21 PDT
Update - Current status: We've identified an issue with a third-party service provider, and we're coordinating with the provider to develop and implement a fix to restore service. We'll provide another update within two hours.

The associated Cloud Service Provider has reported they are beginning to observe some signs of recovery, and have published additional details related to their restoration efforts in response to a fiber cut caused by severe weather conditions here:

https://azure.status.microsoft/en-gb/status
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may experience delays while attempting to access or use Snowflake services and features.

item.title: Azure - West Europe (Netherlands): INC0086591
item.content:encoded:
Jun 16, 03:13 PDT
Resolved - Current status: We've coordinated with our third-party service provider to implement the fix for this issue, and we've monitored the environment to confirm that service was restored. If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have observed that Snowpipe file ingestion is stopped or delayed.
Incident start time: 02:30 UTC June 16, 2023
Incident end time: 08:53 UTC June 16, 2023
Preliminary root cause: A third-party service provider experienced a network issue due to a recent change, which caused customers in the affection region to experience latency accessing Snowflake services. Upon recovery, it was observed that Snowpipe temporarily stopped running due to an unexpected issue with provisioning.

Jun 16, 02:34 PDT
Monitoring - Current status: We've coordinated with our third-party service provider to implement the fix for this issue, and we'll continue to monitor the environment until we're confident all services are functioning properly.
Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may have observed that Snowpipe file ingestion is stopped or delayed.
Incident start time: 02:30 UTC June 16, 2023
Incident end time: 08:53 UTC June 16, 2023
Preliminary root cause: A third-party service provider experienced a network issue due to a recent change, which caused customers in the affection region to experience latency accessing Snowflake services. Upon recovery, it was observed that Snowpipe temporarily stopped running due to an unexpected issue with provisioning.

Customer experience: Customers hosted in the specified regions may observe that Snowpipe file ingestion is stopped or delayed.
Incident start time: 02:30 UTC June 16, 2023

Jun 16, 00:59 PDT
